intro: Biscutella virgata, commonly known as the mountain biscuitroot, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many cruciferous plants. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, gray-green leaves and produces small, yellow flowers in spring. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or mountainous regions. Biscutella virgata is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally by indigenous peoples.
